summary: A bustling trading town known for its markets and craftsmen.

adventureHooks.title: State Audit from Slor'th
adventureHooks.setup: Officials from the state of Slor'th arrive to inspect Slalzan's accounts and levies. Their presence disrupts normal trade and civic business.
adventureHooks.complication: Town records are incomplete or missing; local officials press citizens to keep certain exemptions quiet. Tensions rise between the auditors and municipal authorities.
adventureHooks.reward: Favor with Slor'th's officials, reduced fines or official appointments; access to withheld tax revenues.

adventureHooks.title: The Drying Spring
adventureHooks.setup: A principal well or spring that the small burg depends on is running low or has stopped flowing, threatening water for households and animals.
adventureHooks.complication: The spring's source appears obstructed or diverted; resolving it requires investigating recent earthworks or natural shifts on nearby land.
adventureHooks.reward: Gratitude from townsfolk, small material payment, or an ongoing claim to water access for those who restore the supply.

adventureHooks.title: Roadside Smuggling Ring
adventureHooks.setup: Although Slalzan is not a port, merchants travelling the land routes report goods disappearing before they reach the burg.
adventureHooks.complication: Pursuit of the thieves uncovers a hidden cache or coordinated drops along the road; the network may have connections that reach into Slor'th's jurisdiction.
adventureHooks.reward: Recovered merchandise, monetary rewards from affected merchants, or trade concessions if the ring is broken.

adventureHooks.title: Void Beneath the Burg
adventureHooks.setup: Builders or farmers hit a void or old cellar beneath Slalzan while digging foundations, creating concern for collapsing structures.
adventureHooks.complication: Exploring the void reveals remnants or caches from an earlier time; excavation risks further collapses and civic panic.
adventureHooks.reward: Salvaged goods or valuables, materials recovered for repair, and increased standing with the burg for preventing wider damage.
